column4: Guys, I have a 3com Etherlink III adapter and when I do 'sudo modprobe 3c509', the pc link light on my router doesn't turn on.  Also, I'm getting a 169.* IP address as though this were a Windows private IP thing.  What's happening??
so a router is between you and the internet?
or notepad++
Yeah, there was a router
But dhclient eth0 didn't detect a DHCP server
well, you will get a private IP from a router
I don't understand... the router has DHCP running, and the PC link light isn't glowing.
wifi or lan?
LAN
I'm using a 3com 3c509 NIC.  It's from 1994.
did you have it plugged in when you powered on the machine?
sudo modprobe 3c509 is supposed to make the PC link light show up, but it's not.
Yes.
I've read some terrifying things about downloading a DOS configuration utility to change the IRQ options of the NIC.
when you left click on the network manger icon near the clock is 'wired' and option
I'm on the command line.
!pastebin | cameron_
ahh, well I'm not up on my terminal only info sorry...
have you tried the forums?
Yep.  I've been Googling and forum-searching for almost 2 hours
you may just make a new post and wait a day or two if you can and no one else here can help, sorry I couldn't help more
